attributes.action: Instruct Belfast District Policing Partnership to meet in Public
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
District Policing Partnership are supposed to be about local people getting involved in local policing.

In 2008 the Secretary of State for Northern Ireland reconstituted DPP's in NI. After that Belfast DPP has refused to meet in public.

Every other DPP in Northern Ireland meets in public and allows members of the public to submit questions about policing of their city/town or village.

Why are citizens of Belfast being treated differently ??

It cost the Tax payers £250,000 to fund Belfast DPP in 2008 and yet they don't meet in public and afford the citizens of Belfast the right to question policing of the city.


Prime Minister please Instruct Belfast District Policing Partnership to meet in Public and let citizens of Belfast get involved in local policing as they did prior to 2008.


John Collins
